oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Davidson County Courthouse and the Cumberland River, Nashville, Tennessee, 1960 June
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An aerial view of the Davidson County Courthouse in downtown Nashville, Tennessee, circa June 1960. Includes a view of the Cumberland River as well as some of the buildings at or near the public square, such as Eisele & Co. at 400 1st Avenue N and 905 9th Avenue N and the Sam Lapidus Dry Goods at 336 East Public Square. The Davidson County Courthouse, also known as Metropolitan Courthouse, is an Art Deco building built in 1936. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1987. It was designed by Nashville architect Emmons H. Woolwine and the firm of Dennison and Hirons of New York. Forms part of Record Group 3. The original is a 35 mm color transparency (2 x 2 in. slide mount).
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Davidson County Court House (Nashville, Tenn.); Eisle & Company (Nashville, Tenn.); Sam Lapidus Dry Goods (Nashville, Tenn.)
